snippet: President Obama has spent more campaign cash more quickly than any incumbent in recent history, about $400 million from the beginning of last year to June 30 this year.
abstract: President Obama has spent more campaign cash more quickly than any incumbent in recent history, betting that heavy early investments in personnel, field offices and a high-tech campaign infrastructure will propel him to victory in November; but now his big-dollar bet is being tested; with less than a month to go before the national party conventions begin, the president’s once commanding cash advantage has evaporated, leaving Mitt Romney and the Republican National Committee with about $25 million more cash on hand than the Democrats.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and JO CRAVEN McGINTY
byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett and Derek Willis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama has spent more campaign cash more quickly than any incumbent in recent history, about $400 million from the beginning of last year to June 30 this year.

headline.main: Record Spending by Obama’s Camp Shrinks Coffers
headline.print_headline: Record Spending By Obama’s Camp Shrinks Coffers
